body:
I'd say this is expected behaviour as per the docs, http://www.yiiframework.com/doc-2.0/yii-helpers-baseinflector.html#slug()-detail

> Returns a string with all spaces converted to given replacement, non word characters removed and the rest of characters transliterated.

It only replaces spaces so any subsequent calls would remove the replacements.
I didn't read the docs, i just assumed slug() would do the trick and make me a slug() ;-). Maybe it should be this way? Or renaming the function to replaceSpaces()?

I agree this to be strange behavior. 
It makes no sense to replace and remove the same character at the same time.

The default works for a `-`, you'd need to include the replacement string in the regex.
Could use http://php.net/manual/en/function.preg-quote.php to add it.

issue.title: Create 2.0.16 release

repository.name: yii2

issue.body:
Latest stable release is from March.
There have been quite some bugfixes.

2.0.16 was scheduled for 3rd quarter 
- https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/blob/master/ROADMAP.md
- https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/milestone/25
  Issues should be moved to 2.0.17

I think it also makes sense to have a `2.x` branch.

https://github.com/orgs/yiisoft/projects/14

issue.title: yii\helpers\BaseInflector::slug() doesn't shrink multiple replacement occurences to single

repository.name: yii2
repository.description: Yii 2: The Fast, Secure and Professional PHP Framework

issue.body:
<!--
Please use this issue tracker for bugs and feature requests only. In case you need support please use one of
Yii communities listed at https://github.com/yiisoft/yii2/wiki/communities
-->

### What steps will reproduce the problem?
Inflector::slug(' _ _ remove excess _ _ replacements_', '_');
### What is the expected result?
remove_excess_replacements
### What do you get instead?
remove_excess_____replacements

### Additional info

| Q                | A
| ---------------- | ---
| Yii version      | 2.0.16-2.0.30 since #15204
| PHP version      | 7.0.33
| Operating system | Debian 7
